H6_Notes: Masks are mandatory in companies, offices, open-spaces since September 1. https://web.archive.org/web/20200915134648/https://www.latribune.fr/economie/france/port-du-masque-obligatoire-les-regles-a-connaitre-dans-l-entreprise-855789.html

C3_Notes: The Tour de France started on August 29. https://web.archive.org/web/20200915143200/https://www.lemonde.fr/sport/article/2020/04/15/le-cyclisme-se-raccroche-a-un-tour-decale-fin-aout-pour-assurer-sa-survie_6036621_3242.html

C1_Notes: All students and professors who return to school on Tuesday, 1st September will have to wear masks. If a student displays symptoms, a protocol on dealing with this will be in place. https://web.archive.org/web/20200827221555/https://www.gouvernement.fr/sites/default/files/document/document/2020/08/presentation_-_point_de_situation_sur_la_covid-19_-_27.08.2020.pdf

C8_Notes: The policy has not significantly evolved, the list of non EU countries authorised is updated regularly in consultation with EU members. /web/20200916143049/https://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/fr/le-ministere-et-son-reseau/actualites-du-ministere/informations-coronavirus-covid-19/coronavirus-les-reponses-a-vos-questions/article/coronavirus-les-reponses-a-vos-questions
Ban on certain countries maintained, with exceptions. https://web.archive.org/web/20200916144926/https://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/en/coming-to-france/coronavirus-advice-for-foreign-nationals-in-france/

C2_Notes: Since August 14, several departments (i.e. counties) have 'turned to red', which means that local authorities can decide on restricting activities or closing certain businesses (bars, theatres, pools, markets...). The main departments effected are: The North, the Bas-Rhin, the Seine-Maritime, the C_e-d'Or , the metropolis of Lille, Rouen, Le Havre, Strasbourg, Dijon - the two departments of Corsica (Corsica- du-Sud and Haute-Corse) and Reunion Island. https://web.archive.org/web/20200915142813/https://www.rtbf.be/info/societe/detail_france-sept-nouveaux-departements-classes-en-zone-de-circulation-active-du-coronavirus?id=10577551 https://web.archive.org/web/20200915082254/https://www.bfmtv.com/sante/covid-19-quelles-mesures-les-prefets-peuvent-ils-prendre-dans-les-zones-rouges_AV-202009130122.html https://web.archive.org/web/20200915085810/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus/loisirs Remote work is no longer "the norm" but simply recommended: "Le t____ravail nest plus la norme mais peut rester une solution privil__ier en cas de circulation active du virus." https://web.archive.org/web/20200915082351/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus/retour-au-travail Night clubs have not been allowed to open throughout the period closed.
Nothing has changed with this policy. https://web.archive.org/web/20200701055822/https://www.gouvernement.fr/en/coronavirus-covid-19
C5_Notes: Nothing has changed with this policy. https://web.archive.org/web/20200701055822/https://www.gouvernement.fr/en/coronavirus-covid-19
C7_Notes: Nothing has changed with this policy. https://web.archive.org/web/20200701055822/https://www.gouvernement.fr/en/coronavirus-covid-19

H6_Notes: Masks are still mandatory in all closed spaces https://web.archive.org/web/20200915092101/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus/masques-grand-public and, from August 3, pr__ets can decide to make it mandatory at all times outside the home locally: https://web.archive.org/web/20200915134412/https://twitter.com/JeanCASTEX/status/1290210634722729984?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1290210634722729984%7Ctwgr%5Eshare_3&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.france24.com%2Ffr%2F20200804-quelles-sont-les-villes-de-france-oC3B9-le-masque-est-obligatoire-en-extC3A9rieur This measure has been implemented in various cities. https://web.archive.org/web/20200915092204/https://www.leparisien.fr/societe/la-carte-des-communes-qui-imposent-le-port-du-masque-en-exterieur-02-08-2020-8362416.php

C8_Notes: Travellers from authorised countries outside the EU must provide a negative PCR test, or undergo a test at the airport, or quarantine themselves for 2 weeks. https://web.archive.org/web/20200916140946/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus/vacances

H2_Notes: Tests are free and can be carried out without a medical prescription and on non-symptomatic patients since July 25, 2020. https://web.archive.org/web/20200915140317/https://twitter.com/MinSoliSante/status/1297149019739873280?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1297149019739873280%7Ctwgr%5Eshare_3&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linternaute.fr%2Factualite%2Fguide-vie-quotidienne%2F2489431-test-covid-19-publics-prioritaires-tentes-de-depistage-ce-qui-va-changer%2F "Afin de faciliter le d__istage de la Covid-19, les tests PCR sont totalement pris en charge par l'assurance maladie et ne n__essitent pas de prescription d'un m__ecin". https://web.archive.org/web/20200915135127/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus/tests-et-depistage https://web.archive.org/web/20200915135513/https://solidarites-sante.gouv.fr/soins-et-maladies/maladies/maladies-infectieuses/coronavirus/tout-savoir-sur-la-covid-19/article/se-faire-depister-lieux-et-conditions

H6_Notes: Since 20 July, it is compulsory for all people aged 11 and over to wear face masks in enclosed public spaces. Some local authorities (including Paris) have extended this to outdoor public spaces as well. There is a fine for not complying with these restrictions. Since 11 May, it has been compulsory to wear masks on public transport, taxis, and private hire vehicles that do not have a plexiglass screen. Fines also apply for non-compliance. https://web.archive.org/web/20200831205158/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/france/coronavirus

C3_Notes: In most cities, the 14th of July's festivities were cancelled. Gatherings of more than 5000 are forbidden, but firework shows were still on in some cities, in various locations to avoid the formation of crowds. https://web.archive.org/web/20200915143427/https://france3-regions.francetvinfo.fr/hauts-de-france/carte-14-juillet-covid-19-voici-feux-artifice-concerts-maintenus-nord-pas-calais-1852168.html

Stadiums and racing tracks may reopen to the public from 11 July. There is an upper limit of 5,000 people per venue. https://web.archive.org/web/20200927114257/https://www.gouvernement.fr/en/coronavirus-covid-19 However, at the request of the Council of State which had been seized, demonstrations subject to the obligation of a prior declaration are again authorized. The participants must not be more than 5,000 and must respect the sanitary rules (physical distance of at least one meter between people, systematic wearing of the mask when the respect of this distance is not guaranteed, barrier gestures). https://web.archive.org/web/20200916095459/https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/actualites/A14105

C5_Notes: Started again 22 June: https://web.archive.org/web/20200722155345/https://www.francebleu.fr/infos/transports/transports-en-commun-en-ile-de-france-toutes-les-stations-de-metro-seront-ouvertes-a-partir-du-22-1592483057

C8_Notes: The official EU webpage says the following about quarantine: "No compulsory quarantine for travellers from EU, Schengen area and UK. Quarantine when travelling to overseas and voluntary quarantine for travellers from the UK. Symptomatic travellers during border health checks should be subject to quarantine, regardless of their nationality." https://web.archive.org/web/20200706170147/https://reopen.europa.eu/en/map/FRA

The Schengen space is open to a restricted number of countries since July 1. The list is updated every 2 weeks in accordance to the evolution of the situation in each country. https://web.archive.org/web/20200916142106/https://www.cnewyork.net/2020/07/31/liste-des-pays-autorises-union-europeenne-aout-2020/

C1_Notes: President Macron has announced the reopening of nurseries, schools, and colleges in metropolitan France and overseas, starting on June 22nd. In schools and colleges, physical distance regulations have been eased. Instead of the required 4m2 per pupil, a one-metre distance must be observed between the teacher and pupils (and between pupils themselves) in classrooms and confined spaces. https://web.archive.org/web/20200713070356/https://www.vie-publique.fr/discours/274578-emmanuel-macron-14062020-covid-19
C2_Notes: On 22nd June, the next phase of deconfiment was entered, with the whole of France being declared a "green zone" with little to no workplace closures (except for discotheques and fair grounds). Advice is as following: Working from home must be preferred whenever possible. If you cannot work from home, staggered work patterns must be encouraged, to reduce the numbers of people both in the workplace and in public transport. Therefore, downgraded to 1G; https://web.archive.org/web/20200715180019/https://www.gouvernement.fr/en/coronavirus-covid-19 https://web.archive.org/web/20200629224753/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/europe/macron-details-phase-3-of-deconfinement-in-france/1876966
C5_Notes: True return to normal for almost all public transport in Paris and Ile-de-France. All metro stations will be open from June 22, 2020. Almost all RATP buses, tram, metro and RER are working at 100%. The same goes for the majority of Transilien SNCFs. https://web.archive.org/web/20200722155345/https://www.francebleu.fr/infos/transports/transports-en-commun-en-ile-de-france-toutes-les-stations-de-metro-seront-ouvertes-a-partir-du-22-1592483057
C6_Notes: From June 22, the French government communicates that movements inside cities, between regions, in public transports etc. are allowed. There is no mention of 'staying at home'. https://web.archive.org/web/20200915102027/https://twitter.com/gouvernementFR/status/1276526016803020804/photo/1
C7_Notes: Although travel to French overseas territories is more difficult and restricted, travel within metropolitan France is permitted and citizens may travel freely yet responsibly. Masks must be worn at all times. https://web.archive.org/web/20200701055822/https://www.gouvernement.fr/en/coronavirus-covid-19

Travel to the French overseas territories remains restricted. 'Entry into French Guiana and Mayotte is only allowed for emergency family or work reasons, given that the virus is still actively circulating in these territories. Travellers arriving in these territories will be subject to strict 14-day quarantine measures.'Travelers to other overseas territories are subject to mandatory testing or quarantine. https://archive.vn/WypkZ

C8_Notes: French borders with other EU states are now open. https://web.archive.org/web/20200625232503/https://fr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

C4_Notes: Following the manifestations (protests/demonstrations) in France, the Conseil d'Etat suspends the restriction on public gatherings of 10 people or more, if it is for the purpose of manifesting. Manifestations can gather up to 5000 people. However, the general prohibition on private and public gatherings of more than 10 people remains. https://web.archive.org/web/20200916100611/https://www.liberation.fr/france/2020/06/13/le-conseil-d-etat-suspend-l-interdiction-des-rassemblements-de-plus-de-dix-personnes_1791179

C3_Notes: Officially, gatherings of more than 5000 are forbidden until October 30. https://web.archive.org/web/20200915145022/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus Rallies, although they are officially forbidden, are tolerated in the wake of George Floyd's murder, said the Minister Christophe Castaner. /web/20200915144206/https://www.lexpress.fr/actualite/societe/rassemblements-toleres-contre-les-violences-policieres-colere-de-la-droite-et-du-rn_2127811.html Similarly, the "F_e de la Musique" festivities are officially cancelled, but there is some lack of compliance regarding gatherings in public and in private.

C5_Notes: In Ile-de-France, during peak hours, access to public transport is reserved for people with a travel certificate from their employer or a certificate justifying a specific reason ( list of reasons on the PRIF website ). https://web.archive.org/web/20200611204115/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus/les-actions-du-gouvernement
C6_Notes: As of 2nd June, France began the second stage of deconfinement. There are no longer any stay at home requirements, but working from home is still recommended when possible, and possible outdoor activities are specific and limited to strict social distancing guidelines, so this is still coded as a recommendation to stay home during this 'gradual easing back'. https://web.archive.org/web/20200611204115/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus/les-actions-du-gouvernement
C7_Notes: Travel to overseas territories is limited to people who can "justify an overriding health, family or professional reason." "On your arrival in Guadeloupe, Guyana, Reunion, Martinique, Saint-Martin, Saint-Barth__emy and Saint-Pierre-et-Miquelon, you are invited to remain isolated for 14 days, possibly in an accommodation." https://web.archive.org/web/20200611204115/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus/les-actions-du-gouvernement
C8_Notes: Entry into the territory for travelers from countries outside the European area is prohibited and entry into the territory from the European area is subject to restrictions, until further notice https://web.archive.org/web/20200611204115/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus/les-actions-du-gouvernement

C2_Notes: In most regions, restrictions on work have been lifted, but the government recommends working remotely wherever possible. In regions with local outbreaks, stricter policies may remain in place. https://archive.vn/3Dxvq
E2_Notes: Banks are asked by the government to help out their clients, provide solutions (for instance, postponing loan repayments); but since the government ensures that the population's purchasing power does not lower, there are no official measures with regards to freezing households' financial obligations households (these measures only apply to companies). https://web.archive.org/web/20200608212857/https://point-banque.fr/2020/03/20/la-banque-de-france-exclut-tout-report-des-echeances-bancaires-pour-les-particuliers/
E3_Notes: The government launched a plan to support the car industry. 8 billion euros. https://web.archive.org/web/20200607123510/https://www.economie.gouv.fr/plan-soutien-filiere-automobile

The government launched a plan to support the sectors of tourism, sports and culture: 3 billion euros. https://web.archive.org/web/20200607122854/https://www.economie.gouv.fr/covid19-soutien-entreprises/plan-soutien-secteur-tourisme

C1_Notes: Schools start to reopen. "To meet the fears of teachers and families, the thousands of nursery and primary schools, which reopen, will be subject to a strict health protocol, to avoid any further outbreak of the epidemic." [https://web.archive.org/web/20200520143429/https://www.france24.com/fr/20200512-le-d%C3%A9confinement-continue-en-france-avec-la-r%C3%A9ouverture-des-%C3%A9coles]
C2_Notes: Some shops are re-opening, hairdressers, beauty salons, markets to name a few: https://web.archive.org/web/20200722152406/https://www.connexionfrance.com/French-news/France-deconfinement-May-11-What-is-allowed-or-not-allowed-parks-beaches-schools-bars-restaurants-going-out-travel-transport
C4_Notes: The d__ret of May 11 stipulates that gatherings of more than 10 people are forbidden (except for professional reasons). "Tout rassemblement, r__nion ou activit_ un titre autre que professionnel sur la voie publique ou dans un lieu public, mettant en pr__ence de mani_re simultan__ plus de dix personnes, est interdit sur l'ensemble du territoire de la R__ublique". https://web.archive.org/web/20200916095903/https://www.legifrance.gouv.fr/jorf/id/JORFTEXT000041858681
C5_Notes: As part of France's measures to lift lockdown, "Public transport between regions will also be reduced to ensure people comply and advanced reservation will be compulsory. In the Paris metro, capacity will be reduced to about 70 percent for at least three weeks after May 11. Philippe says only "one seat out of two" will be in use and platforms will be marked to encourage social distancing and the flow of passengers will be reduced for rush hour." [https://web.archive.org/web/20200520113256/https://www.france24.com/en/20200429-key-points-of-france-s-strategy-for-lifting-its-nationwide-covid-19-lockdown]
C6_Notes: People who can work from home are recommended to do so. [https://web.archive.org/web/20200520113256/https://www.france24.com/en/20200429-key-points-of-france-s-strategy-for-lifting-its-nationwide-covid-19-lockdown]
C7_Notes: You can travel up to a maximum of 100km from your home address: https://www.connexionfrance.com/French-news/France-deconfinement-May-11-What-is-allowed-or-not-allowed-parks-beaches-schools-bars-restaurants-going-out-travel-transport
H2_Notes: After May 11, 2020, anyone with symptoms or who has been exposed to a risk of contamination will be tested. "La doctrine scientifique fondant la strat__ie nationale de d__istage virologique applicable compter du 11 mai 2020 consiste d__ister toute personne pr__entant des sympt_es ou ayant ___ expos__ un risque de contamination." https://web.archive.org/web/20200524201028/https://www.gouvernement.fr/sites/default/files/rapport_jean_castex_-_preparation_de_la_sortie_du_confinement.pdf
H3_Notes: May 11 marks the beginning of a gradual deconfinement. Monitoring of all the indicators is underway (the rate of new cases in the population over a period of seven days, the hospital capacities in intensive care remain saturated, the local system of tests and detection of contact cases is not sufficiently ready). This phase will run until June 2. https://web.archive.org/web/20200524220240/https://www.gouvernement.fr/info-coronavirus/les-actions-du-gouvernement
H6_Notes: After May 11, masks are mandatory in public transport. https://web.archive.org/web/20200916092858/https://www.liberation.fr/direct/element/transports-en-commun-le-port-du-masque-obligatoire-a-partir-du-11-mai_112895/ Recommended indoor.

H5_Notes: France to pledge 500 million euros for global coronavirus vaccine hunt', (Monday 4th May 2020). https://uk.reuters.com/article/health-coronavirus-eu-france/macron-france-to-pledge-500-million-euros-for-global-coronavirus-vaccine-hunt-idUKKBN22G1PF

H3_Notes: France is to have brigades of people who will trace contacts of people who test positive for Covid-19 after confinement ends, to help contain further spread of the virus. "Prime minister Edouard Philippe made the announcement as part of his speech on Tuesday April 28. He said: [We want to] protect, test, isolate. In each department, we will have brigades whose job it is to compile a list of contacts, and to call them, to invite them to be tested, telling them where to go for a test, and then to check that these tests have indeed been done." [https://web.archive.org/web/20200514043914/https://www.connexionfrance.com/French-news/Covid-19-coronavirus-contact-tracing-brigades-in-France-What-we-know-so-far]

H6_Notes: France's Director General of Health J___e Salomon said: "We encourage the general public, if they so wish, to wear (...) these alternative masks which are being produced." Masks are not compulsory yet, but recommmended, hence 1G. https://web.archive.org/web/20200916054944/https://www.thelocal.fr/20200406/mask-or-no-mask-what-is-the-official-coronavirus-advice-in-france

The Academy of Medicine recommends wearing a facial mask since April 22. However, the government does not officially recommend wearing masks. https://web.archive.org/web/20200916093621/https://www.france24.com/fr/20200423-covid-19-l-acad%C3%A9mie-de-m%C3%A9decine-appelle-au-port-obligatoire-du-masque https://web.archive.org/web/20200916093701/ https://www.lesechos.fr/industrie-services/pharmacie-sante/les-francais-pourront-se-procurer-des-masques-a-partir-du-4-mai-1197759

C4_Notes: From Tuesday 17th March 2020, seeing anyone is forbidden (except for work, food shopping, health issues and practising outdoor sports alone) hence no gatherings outside household members and coworkers https://web.archive.org/web/20200520140330/https://www.france24.com/en/20200317-france-s-coronavirus-lockdown-what-you-can-and-can-t-do
C6_Notes: March 17 confinement period starts, with people needing a form to leave their houses. They can leave for exercise, grocery shopping, medical appointments, judicial summons, vital family rasons. http://web.archive.org/web/20200425104041/https://www.france24.com/en/20200327-french-pm-extends-coronavirus-lockdown-by-two-weeks-until-april-15 https://web.archive.org/save/https://data.humdata.org/dataset/acaps-covid19-government-measures-dataset
C7_Notes: "France emposes lockdown" https://web.archive.org/web/20200420233355/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/mar/16/coronavirus-spain-takes-over-private-healthcare-amid-more-european-lockdowns
C8_Notes: "Macron Confirms: All External & Internal Schengen Borders Will Close on Tuesday 17th March at Noon" https://web.archive.org/web/20200425221726/https://www.schengenvisainfo.com/news/macron-confirms-all-external-internal-schengen-borders-will-close-on-tuesday-at-noon/ "March 17 : - extraordinary European council by videoconference; - restriction of travel to the strict minimum in the European Union; - closure of the borders of the Schengen area; - activation of the interministerial crisis unit by the Prime Minister." https://web.archive.org/web/20200813100514/https://www.gouvernement.fr/en/coronavirus-covid-19 This 'strict minimum' is: "French citizens and their children are allowed back into the country, but foreigners are only allowed in under certain circumstances. These are People who have their primary residence in France. This does NOT include second home owners. Third country nationals will need to present a visa or residency card while EU nationals (which for this purpose still includes British people) do not need any proof of residency status. People who have their permanent residency in another European country and are travelling through France to get home Healthcare workers engaged in coronavirus-related care Commercial good carriers such as lorry drivers and flight or cargo crews Diplomatic staff Cross-border workers. So for example if you live in France but work in Switzerland you will still be able to travel back and forth." https://web.archive.org/web/20200813101145/https://www.thelocal.fr/20200407/permission-form-now-needed-for-anyone-entering-france
H2_Notes: An in-depth epidemiological inquiry is immediately opened in order to identify and contact everyone who has been in close contact with these patients, Frances health ministry said, after announcing yet more confirmed cases on Feb 26 (2020). https://web.archive.org/save/http://www.rfi.fr/en/france/20200318-france-step-up-coronavirus-new-test-methods-death-toll-climbs-covid-19-priority-risk-elderly-symptoms

C1_Notes: National education minister Jean-Michel Blanquer announces school closures. "From Monday March 16, the order will affect all educational establishments and those that look after children during the day, from all cr_ches to some universities. This includes primary schools, coll_ges and lyc__s." https://twitter.com/franceinter/status/1238361185549987840?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1238361185549987840&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.connexionfrance.com%2FFrench-news%2FCovid-19-coronavirus-in-France-All-the-questions-answered-so-far-as-Macron-and-minister-announce-school-closures-to-halt-virus https://web.archive.org/web/20200417222135/https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/13/coronavirus-france-shuts-schools-to-avoid-being-the-next-italy.html
C5_Notes: "Public transport in built-up areas will be maintained to allow the French to carry out the strictly necessary trips," explained Elisabeth Borne. Longer distance transport between urban areas - by train, coach and plane - will be progressively reduced in order to limit the spread of the virus on national territory. But everyone can return to their home, there will be no sudden stop and no full stop. la ministre de la transition __ologique et solidaire, Elisabeth Borne, et le secr__aire dEtat aux transports, Jean-Baptiste Djebbari, ont d__aill_, dimanche matin, plusieurs mesures dadaptation cette nouvelle donne.  Les transports en commun en agglom__ation seront maintenus pour permettre aux Fran__is daccomplir les d__lacements strictement n__essaires, a expliqu_ Elisabeth Borne. Les transports de plus longue distance entre les agglom__ations par train, car et avion seront progressivement r__uits afin de limiter la propagation du virus sur le territoire national. Mais tout le monde pourra retourner vers son domicile, il ny aura pas darr_ brutal et pas darr_ complet.  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.lemonde.fr/economie/article/2020/03/16/a-travers-l-hexagone-les-transports-en-mode-virus_6033189_3234.html We must absolutely limit movement, meetings and contacts, French prime minister Edouard Philippe said on Saturday evening. Food shops, tobacconists, banks and public transport will remain open, he said. http://web.archive.org/web/20200425101434/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/mar/14/france-closes-non-essential-public-spaces-due-to-coronavirus Long-distance transport (trains, buses, planes) will be "gradually reduced". There will be around 80% of traffic on the metro. http://web.archive.org/web/20200425102359/https://www.connexionfrance.com/French-news/Covid-19-in-France-Transport-trains-buses-planes-SNCF-gradually-reduced-says-transport-minister

Ce fonds sera maintenu autant que durera lurgence sanitaire.https://web.archive.org/save/http://hauts-de-france.direccte.gouv.fr/Coronavirus-COVID-19-mouvements-sociaux-la-Direccte-vous-accompagne

C7_Notes: Prime Minister douard Philippe has asked citizens to work from home and to only go outside to buy essential supplies, take light exercise, and vote in this weekends local elections. All non-essential businesses will be closed and although public transport will remain open, Mr Philippe encouraged residents to limit their use, telling them not to travel between towns unless essential. Archived report: http://web.archive.org/web/20200408102620/https://metro.co.uk/2020/03/14/france-becomes-latest-country-go-lockdown-battle-coronavirus-12398948/?ito=cbshare

C3_Notes: At this point onwards, only essential services are running. Given there was no specific policy for public events, this marks a change of policy for this parameter. https://web.archive.org/web/20200416095041/http://www.leparisien.fr/societe/coronavirus-edouard-philippe-annonce-la-fermeture-des-lieux-publics-non-essentiels-14-03-2020-8280051.php
C4_Notes: France bans gatherings of more than 100 people https://web.archive.org/web/20200425103103/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/france-bans-100-person-gatherings-coronavirus-outbreak-1284472

Gatherings of over 1000 people banned across France. https://web.archive.org/web/20200813095749/https://www.france24.com/en/20200308-france-bans-gatherings-of-more-than-1-000-people-to-contain-coronavirus All public gatherings still banned in certain badly hit regions, hence 4T.

C1_Notes: Nurseries, kindergartens and schools in two departments worst affected by the coronavirus will be closed for two weeks starting Monday, French Prime Minister douard Philippe announced Friday as the death toll from the virus rose to nine with 613 confirmed cases in France. http://web.archive.org/web/20200425094327/https://www.france24.com/en/20200306-macron-urges-limits-to-visits-to-elderly-as-france-s-coronavirus-tolls-rise

Both primary and secondary schools have been shut in the Oise department north of Paris and in Brittany, where the main clusters of French cases have emerged, and where two people who have died of the virus lived. Frances education minister, Jean-Michel Blanquer, said around 120 schools have been ordered to close, most in Brittany and the Oise region north of Paris, which have been hit hard by COVID-19, the disease caused by the new coronavirus. Tens of thousands of students sent home. http://web.archive.org/web/20200425093620/https://www.marketwatch.com/story/france-germany-close-schools-in-virus-cluster-zones-2020-03-03 http://web.archive.org/web/20200425093817/https://www.france24.com/en/20200303-france-shuts-dozens-of-schools-in-areas-hit-by-coronavirus http://web.archive.org/web/20200425094327/https://www.france24.com/en/20200306-macron-urges-limits-to-visits-to-elderly-as-france-s-coronavirus-tolls-rise

Le Figaro is among the established media outlets reporting that all schools in 12 municipalities of Oise and Morbihan (in Northern France and Brittany) are closed from Monday, 2 March 2020 until at least 14 March, 2020. Archived report (in French): https://web.archive.org/web/20200514222523/https://etudiant.lefigaro.fr/article/coronavirus-les-ecoles-de-neuf-communes-de-l-oise-sont-fermees-pour-14-jours_28d727a8-5c60-11ea-8a33-ca35e4bd44df/

C3_Notes: France bans large indoor gatherings with more than 5000 attendees. Measures announced after an emergency cabinet meeting also include the cancellation of the Paris half-marathon which was to be held on Sunday. Among the events affected by the prohibition of large indoor gatherings is Paris's annual agricultural fair. Its final day, which was scheduled for Sunday, has been cancelled. https://web.archive.org/web/20200625172238/https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-51690657 The government has also banned all public gatherings in the Oise district north of Paris and in La Balme-de-Sillingy, a town in the French Alps where cases have been reported. https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-health-france/france-bans-gatherings-of-more-than-5000-due-to-coronavirus-idUSKBN20N0MD
C4_Notes: Generally, indoor gatherings of over 5000 people are banned in France. https://web.archive.org/web/20200813095342/https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-51690657 In the worst hit area of north Paris, all pubic gatherings are banned, hence the 4T coding instead of 1G. "The government has also banned all public gatherings in the Oise district north of Paris and in La Balme-de-Sillingy, a town in the French Alps where cases have been reported." https://web.archive.org/web/20200813095405/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-health-france/france-bans-gatherings-of-more-than-5000-due-to-coronavirus-idUSKBN20N0MD "In the department of Oise, the main epidemic center, and in the town of La Balme-de-Sillingy, in Haute-Savoie, all public gatherings - including masses - are prohibited "until further notice"." https://web.archive.org/web/20200813095458/https://www.lemonde.fr/politique/article/2020/02/29/coronavirus-le-gouvernement-decide-l-interdiction-des-rassemblements-de-plus-de-5-000-personnes-en-milieu-confine-et-de-certains-autres-en-milieu-ouvert-dont-le-semi-marathon-de-paris_6031356_823448.html

C6_Notes: England introduces national lockdown on 5 November: "COVID-19 case numbers are rising rapidly across the whole of the UK and in other countries. We must act now to control the spread of the virus. The single most important action we can all take to fight coronavirus is to stay at home, to protect the NHS and save lives. When we reduce our day-to-day contact with other people, we reduce the spread of the infection. That is why, from Thursday 5 November until Wednesday 2 December, you must: Stay at home, except for specific purposes." https://web.archive.org/web/20201104133027/https://www.gov.uk/guidance/new-national-restrictions-from-5-november#travel
C7_Notes: England introduces national lockdown on 5 November: If you live in England, you cannot travel overseas or within the UK, unless for work, education or other legally permitted reasons, and you should look to reduce the number of journeys you make. https://web.archive.org/web/20201104133027/https://www.gov.uk/guidance/new-national-restrictions-from-5-november#travel
C8_Notes: England introduces national lockdown on 5 November, and a ban on people travelling internationally except for essential work. https://web.archive.org/web/20201104133027/https://www.gov.uk/guidance/new-national-restrictions-from-5-november#travel

E1_Notes: The Prime minister announced on 31st October that the Furlough scheme - will remain open until December, with employees receiving 80% https://web.archive.org/web/20201102194918/https://www.gov.uk/government/news/furlough-scheme-extended-and-further-economic-support-announced
E2_Notes: The UK government announced on 31st September that Borrowers who have been impacted by coronavirus and have not yet had a mortgage payment holiday will be entitled to a six month holiday, and those that have already started a mortgage payment holiday will be able to top up to six months without this being recorded on their credit file. https://web.archive.org/web/20201102194918/https://www.gov.uk/government/news/furlough-scheme-extended-and-further-economic-support-announced
E3_Notes: On 31st October UK government announced that businesses required to close in England due to local or national restrictions will be eligible for the following: For properties with a rateable value of _15k or under, grants to be _1,334 per month, or _667 per two weeks; For properties with a rateable value of between _15k-_51k grants to be _2,000 per month, or _1,000 per two weeks; For properties with a rateable value of _51k or over grants to be _3,000 per month, or _1,500 per two weeks https://web.archive.org/web/20201102194918/https://www.gov.uk/government/news/furlough-scheme-extended-and-further-economic-support-announced
H2_Notes: Policy still in effect
H3_Notes: The latest figure for reaching contacts within 24 hours of them being identified by NHS test and trace is 67%. https://web.archive.org/web/20201102202750/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/oct/11/plans-to-hand-contact-tracing-to-england-local-authorities-come-too-late-covid TAKE NOTE - for future date 4th November - Local COVID-19 case tracing service to launch in targeted area. See archive for further details: https://web.archive.org/web/20201102202339/https://www.richmond.gov.uk/local_covid-19_tracing_service_to_launch

E4_Notes: The UK will also announce _250,000 of new aid funding to support research into the impact of the coronavirus pandemic on women and girls living in fragile and conflict-affected states, such as Afghanistan and Nigeria. The study will develop policy recommendations to ensure women and girls are better protected in future pandemics. https://web.archive.org/web/20201030153431/https://www.gov.uk/government/news/uk-warns-that-peace-talks-fail-without-women

C1_Notes: On Friday 23rd October the Welsh Government introduced a fortnight-long firebreak lockdown meaning schools will close. See Government website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20201101101901/https://gov.wales/schools-coronavirus-firebreak-guidance
C2_Notes: On Friday 23rd October the Welsh Government introduced a fortnight-long firebreak lockdown meaning requires people to work from home, but are able to work safely in their workplaces, can do so, provided their workplace remains open. See Government website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20201101102331/https://gov.wales/coronavirus-firebreak-frequently-asked-questions
C6_Notes: On Friday 23rd October the Welsh Government introduced a fortnight-long firebreak lockdown meaning you should only leave your home for very limited reasons. When you leave home, you should try to minimise time spent outside of the home and ensure you stay at least 2 meters away from anyone outside your household. See Government website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20201101102331/https://gov.wales/coronavirus-firebreak-frequently-asked-question
C7_Notes: On Friday 23rd October the Welsh Government introduced a fortnight-long firebreak lockdown meaning travel is limited to essential travel only, such as, work purposes where people cannot work from home. Travelling within Wales for holiday and visiting friends/family is not permitted See Government website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20201101102331/https://gov.wales/coronavirus-firebreak-frequently-asked-questions

C1_Notes: NI policy still in effect. https://web.archive.org/web/20201015054422/https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-northern-ireland-53007269
C2_Notes: Targeted closing of some sectors, such as cafes that do not serve a substantial meal. https://web.archive.org/web/20201012181705/https://www.gov.uk/government/news/prime-minister-announces-new-local-covid-alert-levels
C4_Notes: Policy still in effect.
C5_Notes: The 'very high level' tier recommends that people "should continue to travel to venues or amenities that are open, for work or to access education, but aim to reduce the number of journeys you make." https://web.archive.org/web/20201030131830/https://www.gov.uk/guidance/local-covid-alert-levels-what-you-need-to-know
C6_Notes: Restrictions on socialising are in place across the UK, and yet all 3 tiers of policy still allow at least some forms of nonessential activity (tier 3 still permits weddings, dining out, sport, religious services). As such, the policy seems to be best characterised as a general restriction on social and public activity while not actually recommending 'staying at home'. https://web.archive.org/web/20201030131830/https://www.gov.uk/guidance/local-covid-alert-levels-what-you-need-to-know
C7_Notes: Recommended but not required for tier-3 areas. https://web.archive.org/web/20201030131830/https://www.gov.uk/guidance/local-covid-alert-levels-what-you-need-to-know
C8_Notes: No change in policy.
E1_Notes: Wage subsidy extended to the end of October. https://web.archive.org/web/20201030151241if_/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-britain-loans-idUSKBN233141
E2_Notes: Policy still in effect.
E3_Notes: Government announced a range of measures including the following: open businesses which are experiencing considerable difficulty will be given extra help to keep staff on as government significantly increases contribution to wage costs under the Job Support Scheme, and business contributions drop to 5% business grants are expanded to cover businesses in particularly affected sectors in high-alert level areas, helping them stay afloat and protecting jobs grants for the self-employed doubled to 40% of previous earnings. Figure taken from announcements of up to _1 billion in business grants and _3.1 billion in self-employed support, but does not reflect the full cost of the announced programmes. "Todays announcement increases the amount of profits covered by the forthcoming self-employed grant from 20 per cent to 40 per cent, meaning the maximum grant will increase from _1,875 to _3,750. This is a potential further _3.1 billion of support to the self-employed through November to January alone, with a further grant to follow covering February to April." https://web.archive.org/web/20201030152723/https://www.gov.uk/government/news/plan-for-jobs-chancellor-increases-financial-support-for-businesses-and-workers
E4_Notes: **TAKE NOTE** only announced, not donated, so I haven't recorded it - but be aware of the following dated. 29th October: The UK will also announce _250,000 of new aid funding to support research into the impact of the coronavirus pandemic on women and girls living in fragile and conflict-affected states, such as Afghanistan and Nigeria. The study will develop policy recommendations to ensure women and girls are better protected in future pandemics. https://web.archive.org/web/20201030153431/https://www.gov.uk/government/news/uk-warns-that-peace-talks-fail-without-women
H2_Notes: Policy still in effect.
H3_Notes: "The system is having a marginal impact on transmission, as a result, and unless it grows as fast as the epidemic that impact will only wane." Only about 75% success rate in tracking contacts, and less than 20% of contacts are isolating in case of exposure or demonstrating symptoms. Therefore, the system remains overwhelmed and limited. https://web.archive.org/web/20201030154221/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/oct/13/what-has-gone-wrong-with-englands-covid-test-and-trace-system

C2_Notes: On 24 September, the UK government announced the following updates: "Businesses selling food or drink (including cafes, bars, pubs and restaurants), social clubs, casinos, bowling alleys, amusement arcades (and other indoor leisure centres or facilities), funfairs, theme parks, adventure parks and activities, and bingo halls, must be closed between 10pm and 5am. This will include takeaways but delivery services can continue after 10pm (from 24 September).". Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200924224845/https://www.gov.uk/government/news/coronavirus-covid-19-what-has-changed-22-september
C4_Notes: On 24 September, the UK government imposed stricter restrictions on gatherings: "Support groups must be limited to a maximum of 15 people (from 24 September). Indoor organised sport for over 18s will no longer be exempt from the rule of six. There is an exemption for indoor organised team sports for disabled people (from 24 September). There will be a new exemption in those areas of local intervention where household mixing is not allowed to permit friends and family to provide informal childcare for children under 14 (from 24 September). Weddings and civil partnership ceremonies and receptions will be restricted to a maximum of 15 people (down from 30). Other significant standalone life events will be subject to the rule of six limits, except funerals (from 28 September)." Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200924224845/https://www.gov.uk/government/news/coronavirus-covid-19-what-has-changed-22-september
C6_Notes: On the 22nd of September, the British government, in the grip of a second wave of coronavirus, told the nations workers to work from home if they could, a policy reversal that forced banks and other employers to readjust their corporate policies on the fly. We are once again asking office workers who can work from home to do so, Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Tuesday, adding that Britain had reached a perilous turning point as nearly 5,000 new coronavirus cases were reported the same day. Scottish, Northern Ireland, and Wales governments all were advising that where possible, people should work from home prior (hence 0 is likely wrong for previous codings as the change coding to 0 was referring to the Leicester case and ignored Scottish advise that originally prompted the 1T coding). https://web.archive.org/web/20201004232124/https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/09/22/business/stock-market-today-coronavirus https://www.instituteforgovernment.org.uk/explainers/coronavirus-lockdown-rules-four-nations-uk (not archivable, summary for Scotland/Wales/NI governments)
E3_Notes: On 24 September, in Wales, "Finance Minister Conor Murphy announced a raft of funding measures to address the impact of coronavirus totalling _165m. This includes _29m funding for the arts sector, as well as _40m for councils, _29m for tourism and business, including a holiday-at-home voucher scheme, _14.8m for the A6 and _15m for NI Water." 265 million pounds = 210,446,294.374792 USD (conversion rate for 24 September) Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200924233656/https://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/news/health/coronavirus/coronavirus-northern-ireland-announcement-on-pub-curfew-delayed-as-new-funding-measures-unveiled-39558452.html
H3_Notes: 24 September The UK government has launched a new COVID-19 tracing app in England and Wales. Link: Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200924221749/https://www.gov.uk/government/news/nhs-covid-19-app-launches-across-england-and-wales
H6_Notes: In England, you must wear a face covering in the following indoor settings: public transport (aeroplanes, trains, trams and buses). Taxis and private hire vehicles (PHVs). Transport hubs (airports, rail and tram stations and terminals, maritime ports and terminals, bus and coach stations and terminals). Shops and supermarkets (places which offer goods or services for retail sale or hire. Shopping centres (malls and indoor markets) auction houses. Premises providing hospitality (bars, pubs, restaurants, cafes), except when seated at a table to eat or drink. Post offices, banks, building societies, high-street solicitors and accountants, credit unions, short-term loan providers, savings clubs and money service businesses. Estate and lettings agents. Theatres premises providing personal care and beauty treatments (hair salons, barbers, nail salons, massage centres, tattoo and piercing parlours). Premises providing veterinary services. Visitor attractions and entertainment venues (museums, galleries, cinemas, theatres, concert halls, cultural and heritage sites, aquariums, indoor zoos and visitor farms, bingo halls, amusement arcades, adventure activity centres, indoor sports stadiums, funfairs, theme parks, casinos, skating rinks, bowling alleys, indoor play areas including soft-play areas). Libraries and public reading rooms. Places of worship funeral service providers (funeral homes, crematoria and burial ground chapels). Community centres, youth centres and social clubs. Exhibition halls and conference centres, public areas in hotels and hostels. Storage and distribution facilities You are expected to wear a face covering before entering any of these settings and must keep it on until you leave unless there is a reasonable excuse for removing it. You should also wear a face covering in indoor places not listed here where social distancing may be difficult and where you will come into contact with people you do not normally meet. https://web.archive.org/web/20201104080631/https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/face-coverings-when-to-wear-one-and-how-to-make-your-own/face-coverings-when-to-wear-one-and-how-to-make-your-own

C2_Notes: On 23 September, the Scottish government imposed the following updated restrictions: "Pubs, restaurants and all hospitality settings will be required to close at 10pm Table service will continue to be required in all hospitality premises" Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200924230708/https://www.gov.scot/news/new-measures-to-drive-down-infection-rate/
C4_Notes: On 23 September, the Scottish government imposed new restrictions on gatherings: "Measures include: Inside peoples homes (from tomorrow, Wednesday 23 2020) Do not meet people from any other households in your home or another persons home socially, unless they are in your extended household These rules also apply to children Children whose parents do not live in the same household can move between homes, as can non-cohabiting couples Very limited exemptions apply for childcare, and for tradespeople Private gardens or public outdoors spaces (from tomorrow, Wednesday 23 September 2020) A maximum of six people from two households can meet in outdoor spaces You should limit as far as possible the total number of households you meet in a day Under-12s do not count towards the maximum number of households or number of people who can meet outdoors. Under-12s do not have to physically distance A maximum of six 12 to 17 year olds can meet in outdoor spaces, with no household limit. Physical distancing is still required Indoors in public spaces (from tomorrow, Wednesday September 23 2020) A maximum of six people from two households can meet in public indoor spaces such as cafes, pubs and restaurants Children under 12 from those two households do not count towards the limits" Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200924230708/https://www.gov.scot/news/new-measures-to-drive-down-infection-rate/

From 22 September, people from different households in Northern Ireland are no longer allowed to mix indoors at all. https://web.archive.org/web/20201003192613/https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-northern-ireland-53007269

C4_Notes: With Wales and England limiting meetings or gatherings indoors even within your extended household to 6 people (not including any children aged under 11 in Wales) on September 14, all areas of the UK (England, Wales, Scotland, Northern Ireland) have gathering restrictions that rise to a 4 in the coding. Therefore, the coding is upgraded to 4G on review. It should be noted, however, that technically not ALL private gatherings are reduced to a level 4 due to Wales allowing outdoor gatherings of slightly bigger groups. On rainy days, of which Wales has a considerable amount, outdoor gatherings outside of someones gardens (for which the rule of six applies even outside) are somewhat unlikely and a coding of 4 is therefore appropriate. https://web.archive.org/web/20201004213732/https://gov.wales/guidance-leaving-your-home-and-seeing-other-people-coronavirus (Wales) https://web.archive.org/web/20201004214002/https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-51506729 (England) https://web.archive.org/web/20201004214404/https://www.irishpost.com/news/rule-of-six-how-todays-new-social-gathering-restrictions-affect-you-192812 (NI) (Scotland in previous sources)
H6_Notes: From 14 September, the Welsh government effectively required face coverings in *ALL indoor public places*, for both customers and staff working in those indoor public areas. This includes a very wide range of locations, such as shops and shopping centres, places of worship, hairdressers and salons, cinemas and museums, gyms and leisure centres, and anywhere that is open to members of the public. It would also include any public areas within buildings that are otherwise closed to the public for example a reception area of an office building. The only indoor public areas where face coverings will not be required are where you are inside a place to eat or drink, for example, caf__, restaurants and pubs - but only for the purpose of eating or drinking. Since all nations of the UK now have a 2 in place, upgraded to 2G (see subnational coding). https://web.archive.org/web/20201003210731/https://gov.wales/face-coverings-guidance-public

C4_Notes: "Following a sharp increase in coronavirus (COVID-19) cases in the Caerphilly County Borough Council area, new rules have been introduced to reduce the spread of the virus and protect public health. They impose restrictions in the area that are stricter than the rest of Wales. The restrictions came into force at 6pm on 8 September 2020 and will be kept under review. People will only be able to meet outdoors for the time being. People will not be able to meet members of their extended household indoors or form an extended household (sometimes known as a bubble). This means meeting indoors (in peoples houses, in a pub or elsewhere) with anyone you dont live with is not allowed at the moment unless you have a good reason, such as providing care to a vulnerable person." Link: https://archive.fo/pLH1p
C7_Notes: "Following a sharp increase in coronavirus (COVID-19) cases in the Caerphilly County Borough Council area, new rules have been introduced to reduce the spread of the virus and protect public health. They apply to everyone living or working in the Caerphilly County Borough Council area and to people who may want to visit the area: People will not be allowed to enter or leave the Caerphilly County Borough Council area without a reasonable excuse" Link: https://archive.fo/pLH1p

C2_Notes: In England, the Prime minister announced a postponement of the opening of casinos, bowling alleys, skating rinks and remaining close contact services until 15 August. In Leicester city, leisure centres, gyms and pools must remain closed. However, all non-essential shops can reopen. In Bradford the following premises which were previously permitted to be open must now be closed by law: indoor gyms, indoor fitness and dance studios, indoor, sports courts and facilities, indoor swimming pools, including indoor facilities at water parks. In Northern Ireland, still closed are nightclubs and swimming pools. In Wales and Scotland, sectors including indoor gyms and swimming pools remain closed. Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200803230719/https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/prime-ministers-statement-on-coronavirus-covid-19-31-july-2020 https://web.archive.org/web/20200803223157/https://www.gov.uk/guidance/31-july-announcement https://web.archive.org/web/20200803231158/https://www.gov.uk/guidance/north-west-of-england-local-restrictions-what-you-can-and-cannot-do https://web.archive.org/web/20200803232656/https://www.scotsman.com/lifestyle/outdoors/when-will-gyms-open-scotland-date-fitness-centres-could-reopen-lockdown-rules-are-relaxed-2843157 https://web.archive.org/web/20200803232820/https://www.nidirect.gov.uk/articles/coronavirus-covid-19-regulations-guidance-and-what-they-mean-you
C4_Notes: In Northern Ireland, groups of 30 can meet outdoors, and 6 indoors. In Scotland, people can meet in groups of up to 15 people outdoors, from up to 5 different households, including your own household. From 10 July limited indoor gatherings will also be permitted. A maximum of 8 people, from up to 3 different households can meet indoors. In England it is against the law for gatherings of more than 30 people to take place in private homes (including gardens and other outdoor spaces) except where specified in the Regulations. Greater Manchester, East Lancashire and parts of West Yorkshire: Prohibition of gatherings with people from other households in home or garden. C2_Notes: 22 July In Northern Ireland, still closed are nightclubs and swimming pools. In Wales and Scotland, sectors including indoor gyms and swimming pools remain closed. The following businesses and venues in England are due to reopen from 25 July, as outlined in the table below with links to guidance to ensure their safe opening: Indoor fitness and dance studios, Indoor gyms, Indoor sports courts and facilities, Indoor swimming pools and indoor water parks. So as of 22 July, some sectors are still closed in England. In the city of Leicester, which is under a stricter lockdown due to a rise in cases, most businesses are closed, though cafes and restaurants can operate takeaway services. I have coded this as a 2 (some sectors closed), as these are not essential workplaces, which is the same coding as the rest of GBR, so the coding remains as a 2G despite this internal variation within 2. C3_Notes: 22 July In England: Businesses and venues following COVID-19 Secure guidelines can host larger groups. Any other gathering in an outdoor space must not be any larger than 30 people except where specified in the Regulations. At this time, venues should not permit live performances, including drama, comedy and music, to take place in front of a live audience; and should not permit indoor grassroots sport to take place. Local authorities should avoid issuing licenses for events that could lead to larger gatherings forming and provide advice to businesses on how to manage events of this type. In Scotland: live indoor and outdoor events (e.g. theatres) wont be allowed before 31 July. Northern Ireland wont permit indoor public events until 28 August. In Wales people must not gather in public places other than with members of one other household or extended household, except for organised outdoor activities with a maximum of 30 people. *I have interpreted this as an ongoing ban of large public events across GBR* England https://web.archive.org/web/20200713162135/https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/further-businesses-and-premises-to-close/further-businesses-and-premises-to-close-guidance Scotland https://web.archive.org/web/20200711004446/https://news.sky.com/story/coronavirus-lockdown-what-you-can-and-cant-do-after-changes-across-uk-12013295 Northern Ireland https://web.archive.org/web/20200711004446/https://news.sky.com/story/coronavirus-lockdown-what-you-can-and-cant-do-after-changes-across-uk-12013295 Wales https://web.archive.org/web/20200717174831/https://gov.wales/coronavirus-regulations-guidance

H4_Notes: Boris Johnson 'I can confirm that were providing an additional _3bn of funding for the NHS in England to get ready for winter. This will allow the NHS to continue to use the extra hospital capacity acquired from the independent sector, and also to maintain the Nightingale hospitals, until the end of March.' Coded this as H4 as this emergency spending to prepare for winter is as a result of the COVID 19 outbreak. Media Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200717101318/https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2020/jul/17/uk-coronavirus-live-boris-johnson-3bn-plan-nhs-battle-ready-for-winter-second-wave _3bn = 3,764,384,670 USD

E3_Notes: "UK finance minister Rishi Sunak has unveiled another _30 billion ($37.6 billion) coronavirus stimulus package aimed at stemming Britain's growing jobs crisis and lifting the economy out of its worst slump in centuries. The spending announced Wednesday brings the government's stimulus layouts to roughly _166 billion ($208 billion), or 7.4% of 2019 GDP, according to Paul Dales, chief UK economist at Capital Economics." https://web.archive.org/web/20200812172209/https://edition.cnn.com/2020/07/08/business/uk-economy-coronavirus-stimulus/index.html

C4_Notes: From 13th June, it is permitted in England and NI to form a support bubble with "one other household if you live alone or are a single parent with dependent children - in other words, you are in a household where there is only one adult. All those in a support bubble will be able to act as if they live in the same household - meaning they can spend time together inside each others homes and do not need to stay 2 metres apart. Support bubbles should be exclusive - meaning you should not switch the household you are in a bubble with or connect with multiple households". For others in England, "You will still be able to meet outdoors with groups of up to six people from different households, provided social distancing is observed". In Northern Ireland, you can meet with up to 10 people outdoors. https://web.archive.org/web/20200621103610/https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/coronavirus-outbreak-faqs-what-you-can-and-cant-do/coronavirus-outbreak-faqs-what-you-can-and-cant-do

C2_Notes: Scotland is the final devolved nation to open up non essential businesses meaning GBR is now a 2G From 29 May, most outdoor work that has been put on hold can resume, and the construction industry will be able to restart site preparation. Garden centres and plant nurseries can reopen some of their services, and the government will no longer be discouraging drive-through food outlets from re-opening. Non-essential shops, and pubs, restaurants and cafes - except for takeaway - must remain closed at this stage. Household waste recycling centres can re-open from Monday (1 June) http://archive.vn/iZr7V

H3_Notes: A NHSTest and Trace policy is being rolled out, intended to 'ensure that anyone who develops symptoms of coronavirus (COVID-19) can quickly be tested to find out if they have the virus, and also include targeted asymptomatic testing of NHS and social care staff and care home residents'; to 'help trace close recent contacts of anyone who tests positive for coronavirus and, if necessary, notify' them that they must self-isolate at home to help stop the spread of the virus'. As of May 27, 'This specific guidance applies in England only. All 4 administrations are working closely together to have a consistent and joined-up approach to testing and tracing.' https://web.archive.org/web/20200603202542/https://www.gov.uk/guidance/nhs-test-and-trace-how-it-works

C1_Notes: From the week commencing 1 June:  nurseries and other early year providers, including childminders, to begin welcoming back all children  primary schools to welcome back children in nursery (where they have them), reception, year 1 and year 6  secondary schools, sixth form, and further education colleges to begin some face to face support with year 10 and 12 pupils, although we do not expect these pupils to return on a full-time basis at this stage  all schools and childcare providers to continue to offer places to the priority groups vulnerable children and children of critical workers they have been supporting since the end of March  special schools, special post-16 institutions and hospital schools to work towards a phased return of more children and young people without a focus on specific year groups and informed by risk assessments  alternative provision to welcome back children in reception, year 1 and year 6 and begin some face to face support with year 10 and 11 pupils (as they have no year 12) This approach aims to limit numbers within schools and further education settings while ensuring that the children and young people who can benefit from attending most are able to do so. https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/closure-of-educational-settings-information-for-parents-and-carers/reopening-schools-and-other-educational-settings-from-1-june

C2_Notes: 21 March The government is asking the following businesses and other venues across the United Kingdom to close as soon as they reasonably can, and not to open for trade from Saturday 21 March: Cinemas, Theatres, Nightclubs, Bingo halls, Concert halls, Museums and galleries, Casinos, Betting shops, Spas, Massage parlours, Indoor skating rinks, Indoor fitness studios, gyms, swimming pools or other indoor leisure centres. Restaurants, bars, and cafes must convert to take-away or delivery only. H4_Notes: On 6 August, President Jair Bolsonaro signed a Provisional Measure that provides resources for the production and acquisition of the vaccine produced by AstraZeneca and the University of Oxford. The budget credit of R $ 1.9 billion (USD 355.9 million) is expected to allow the acquisition and production of 100 million doses. The exchange rate on 6 August is: 1,900,000,000.00 BRL = 355943708 USD http://web.archive.org/web/20200809180730/http://www.saude.gov.br/noticias/agencia-saude/47321-presidente-assina-medida-provisoria-que-garante-producao-de-vacina-contra-a-covid-19

C8_Notes: From 29 July, Brazil has officially reopened its borders to international travel, which had been banned since March. However, an additional 30 days ban on the entry of foreigners by land (unless for transit) and sea has been extended. The borders are open to nationals, residents, and tourists. Non-resident foreigners can enter for a period not exceeding 90 days and must show proof of the purchase of valid health insurance in Brazil with coverage for the entire period of travel. This insurance is required for each of the passengers traveling to Brazil, however, does not apply to: * Brazilian citizens * Foreigners residing in Brazil * International transit passengers (as long as they remain in the departure lounge) Official announcement (Portuguese): http://web.archive.org/web/20200809164216/https://pesquisa.in.gov.br/imprensa/jsp/visualiza/index.jsp?jornal=600&pagina=1&data=29%2F07%2F2020&totalArquivos=1 Official source (English): http://archive.fo/sf6aX News coverage (English): http://web.archive.org/web/20200809164424/https://www.reuters.com/article/health-coronavirus-brazil-travel/update-1-brazil-reopens-international-flights-to-tourists-even-as-coronavirus-deaths-spike-idUSL2N2F036J

C1_Notes: On 3 August, the Ministry of Education announced an extension of non-classroom activities of the Federal Education Network in technical courses until December 2020. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the institutions had already been authorized to continue the technical courses in a non-face-to-face manner since April. This rule, however, was due to expire on 4 August, and the new policy is effective from 5 August. On the other hand, in-person classes are expected to resume from 10 August in the city of Manaus, for pupils over 15 years old. Official announcement: http://web.archive.org/web/20200809165951/https://www.gov.br/mec/pt-br/assuntos/noticias/nova-portaria-prorroga-autorizacao-para-atividades-nao-presenciais-em-cursos-tecnicos-ate-dezembro Schools reopening in Manaus: http://web.archive.org/web/20200809170221/https://brazilian.report/coronavirus-brazil-live-blog/2020/07/29/largest-amazon-city-brazil-first-to-reopen-schools/

As of 7 August, most non-essential activities are still prohibited in red regions, the ones affected the most by the pandemic. http://web.archive.org/web/20200809172753/https://www.saopaulo.sp.gov.br/planosp/

H4_Notes: More than R $ 157 million has already been transferred by the Federal Government to assist the social assistance network of states and municipalities in the period of pandemic caused by the new coronavirus. The resource is intended for the purchase of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) for workers in the network of the Unified Social Assistance System (Sua) of states and municipalities. The second installment of the emergency transfer, paid in July, exceeded the amount of R $ 58 million.' http://archive.fo/ng925

C2_Notes: While several states are reopening (or have reopened) non-essential businesses, restrictions were tightened in a few locations this week due to rising ICU occupancy rates.' http://archive.fo/UsFdj
E1_Notes: The Federal Government has extended deadlines for the Emergency Employment and Income Maintenance Program for another two months. According to the decree, the maximum term for the proportional reduction agreement of the working day and salary, which was 90 days, will now be 120 days. The term for the temporary suspension of the contract, which was 60 days, also changes to 120. For employees with intermittent employment contracts, the decree establishes the payment of an emergency benefit of R $ 600.00 for another month, counting from the closing date of the three-month period, for employees with formalized employment contracts until April 1, publication date of the PM creating the program. Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200716184724/https://www.gov.br/pt-br/noticias/trabalho-e-previdencia/2020/07/programa-emergencial-de-manutencao-do-emprego-e-prorrogado

H4_Notes: Brazil already has 9,273 ICU beds authorized by the Federal Government to treat exclusively severely or very seriously ill patients with Covid-19. Of the total, 247 of them are from pediatric ICUs. In all, the Ministry of Health made a contribution of approximately R $ 1.3 billion, paid in a single installment, so that states and municipalities can afford these beds for the next 90 days or as long as there is a need due to the pandemic. On Monday (13), 146 more ICU beds were enabled, at a cost of R $ 21 million. The qualifications covered municipalities in the states of Rio Grande do Norte, Esp_ito Santo and Rio Grande do Sul. Link:http://web.archive.org/web/20200716185649/https://www.gov.br/pt-br/noticias/financas-impostos-e-gestao-publica/2020/07/uniao-repassa-mais-de-r-30-bilhoes-para-estados

E3_Notes: July 13 - Banco do Brasil credited the funds corresponding to the second installment of the financial assistance provided for in Supplementary Law 173/2020 . The amounts will be deposited in the same accounts as the State Participation Fund (FPE) and the Municipality Participation Fund (FPM). A total of R $ 15.038 billion will be deposited for subnational entities. The Complementary Law, signed by President Bolsonaro in March, allows the granting of federal aid of around R $ 60.15 billion to states, municipalities and the Federal District to strengthen actions to combat the new coronavirus. The transfer is being made in four installments. I believe this measure was already captured by earlier entries. Here I am only documenting the disbursement. Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200716185245/https://www.gov.br/pt-br/noticias/financas-impostos-e-gestao-publica/2020/07/estados-e-municipios-recebem-auxilio-de-mais-de-r-15-bilhoes

H4_Notes: To guarantee the protection of health professionals who work on the front line of the fight against Covid-19, the Ministry of Health has already distributed $RS163.3 million Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) throughout the country. Among the items are masks, aprons, glasses and face shields, caps, sneakers, gloves and alcohol. Deliveries are to assist and strengthen the health networks of states and municipalities in combating the Covid-19 pandemic. Note: this amount could be double-counting with data for H4 Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200716184324/https://www.gov.br/pt-br/noticias/saude-e-vigilancia-sanitaria/2020/07/ministerio-da-saude-ja-distribuiu-mais-de-r-163-milhoes-de-epis

E2_Notes: Government exempted collection of Credit Opening Tariff for program credit line http://web.archive.org/web/20200716191748/https://www.gov.br/pt-br/noticias/trabalho-e-previdencia/2020/07/micro-e-pequenos-empresarios-contam-com-linha-de-credito-durante-pandemia

E1_Notes: July 7 - Law no. 14.020 institutes the Emergency Employment and Income Maintenance Program. The new law originates from Provisional Measure 936, issued by the government in early April. The program provides for the granting of the Emergency Employment and Income Preservation Benefit to workers who have reduced working hours or a suspended contract, and also emergency assistance for intermittent workers with a formalized employment contract, under the terms of the provisional measure. The value of the Emergency Employment and Income Preservation Benefit will be based on the calculation of the monthly amount of unemployment insurance to which the employee would be entitled. In the event of temporary suspension of the employment contract, it will have monthly value: I - in the event of a reduction in working hours and wages, it will be calculated by applying the percentage of the reduction to the calculation basis; and II - in the event of temporary suspension of the employment contract, it will have monthly value: a) equivalent to 100% (one hundred percent) of the unemployment insurance amount to which the employee would be entitled b) equivalent to 70% (seventy percent) of the unemployment insurance amount to which the employee would be entitled Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200716181745/http://www.in.gov.br/en/web/dou/-/lei-n-14.020-de-6-de-julho-de-2020-265386938 http://web.archive.org/web/20200716182541/https://www.gov.br/economia/pt-br/centrais-de-conteudo/publicacoes/boletins/covid-19/timeline/julho/7-de-julho-de-2020 No official declaration on the amount of the measure was mentioned. However, to guarantee the payment of the so-called Emergency Job and Income Preservation Benefit (BEm), the federal government will have to invest between R $ 26.1 and R $ 52.6 billion, according to an analysis by the Independent Tax Institution (IFI) of the Senate. Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200716182524/https://www2.senado.leg.br/bdsf/bitstream/handle/id/574054/NT44.pdf Link:http://web.archive.org/web/20200716182552/https://www12.senado.leg.br/noticias/materias/2020/07/06/uniao-investira-ate-r-53-bi-para-compensar-reducao-de-salario-e-jornada-avalia-ifi
E3_Notes: July 7 - Law no. 14.020 institutes the Emergency Employment and Income Maintenance Program. The new law originates from Provisional Measure 936, issued by the government in early April. The program provides for the granting of the Emergency Employment and Income Preservation Benefit to workers who have reduced working hours or a suspended contract, and also emergency assistance for intermittent workers with a formalized employment contract, under the terms of the provisional measure. Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200716181745/http://www.in.gov.br/en/web/dou/-/lei-n-14.020-de-6-de-julho-de-2020-265386938 http://web.archive.org/web/20200716182541/https://www.gov.br/economia/pt-br/centrais-de-conteudo/publicacoes/boletins/covid-19/timeline/julho/7-de-julho-de-2020 No official declaration on the amount of the measure was mentioned. However, to guarantee the payment of the so-called Emergency Job and Income Preservation Benefit (BEm), the federal government will have to invest between R $ 26.1 and R $ 52.6 billion, according to an analysis by the Independent Tax Institution (IFI) of the Senate. I assumed that the amount would fall under the previously announced budget at the beginning of April. Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200716182524/https://www2.senado.leg.br/bdsf/bitstream/handle/id/574054/NT44.pdf Link:http://web.archive.org/web/20200716182552/https://www12.senado.leg.br/noticias/materias/2020/07/06/uniao-investira-ate-r-53-bi-para-compensar-reducao-de-salario-e-jornada-avalia-ifi

E2_Notes: To reduce the impact on distributors and consumers, the Federal Government carried out a series of actions, such as the suspension of the electricity cut due to non-payment from April to the end of July. An exemption from energy tariffs for low-income consumers was also instituted for 90 days. Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200716190150/https://www.aneel.gov.br/sala-de-imprensa-exibicao-2/-/asset_publisher/zXQREz8EVlZ6/content/covid-19-aneel-publica-esclarecimentos-sobre-isencao-de-tarifa-para-baixa-renda/656877?inheritRedirect=false
